abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Kerala State
            Transport Project (KSTP) for India are: (a) to improve
            traffic flow and road safety on the state's primary
            road network, and (b) strengthen institutional and financial
            capacities of the key transport sector agencies. The
            changes, involving modifications in project outcome
            indicator targets, will constitute a first order project
            restructuring. The restructuring is aimed towards partially
            mitigating the loss of time and cost savings benefits
            arising from exclusion of the second phase corridor
            improvement works. Moreover, through the restructuring, the
            project development impact can be extended by bringing in
            additional 200 km of primary road network under improved
            periodic maintenance and safety management framework.
